intro: Byttneria jaramilloana, commonly known as the Jaramillo's sandpaper tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its rough, sandpaper-like bark and palmate leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in dry to semi-arid conditions and is often found in disturbed habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
